cnss.simulator

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • cnss.simulator.Node

  • public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    The Node class represents a node in the network. Each node references its own control algorithm class, whose name was provided in the constructor. A node looks up the class from its name and instantiates it using java reflection. The same applies for the application code the node executes.
    Version:
    1.0, September 2020
    Author:
    System's team of the Department of Informatics of FCT/UNL based on a, preliminary version by Adam Greenhalgh of UCL

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Node(int i, int n, java.lang.String c, java.lang.String a, java.lang.String[] ags, GlobalParameters gp)
      Node constructor takes the node id, the number of interfaces, the class name of the control algorithm to load as well as the class name of the application algorithm.

      Process the Events scheduled by the simulator for this processing step
      void send(DataPacket p)
      Sends an application DataPacket; by convention the input interface of a locally created and sent packet is the local interface (-1) this method is to be be used by the application algorithm
      void send(Packet p, int iface)
      Sends a Packet using a given interface Besides increasing counters, this could be done by Control Algorithms It is however, cleaner and better practice to make it available here to be shared by all different ControlAlgorithms

      Installs a control timeout The reception of a data message before or at now+t cancels all control timeouts (including those to be delivered in the same time step)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node(int i,
            int n,
            java.lang.String c,
            java.lang.String a,
            java.lang.String[] ags,
            GlobalParameters gp)
        Node constructor takes the node id, the number of interfaces, the class name of the control algorithm to load as well as the class name of the application algorithm. If the control algorithm class is not found, prints an exception. If the application algorithm class is not found, prints an exception.
        Parameters:
        i - node id
        n - number of interfaces
        c - class name of the control algorithm to load.
        a - class name of the application algorithm to load.
        ags - the arguments for this node
        gp - a reference to the global parameters collection

    • Method Detail

      • addLinks

        public void addLinks(Link l)
        Add a link to the Node so the node knows about its attached links. A Node has 0 to num_interfaces links each connected to the Link links[i]. Additionally, there is a virtual interface numbered LOCAL, the local interface. It is only used as the sending interface when the node sends a local packet.
        Parameters:
        l - the link to attach.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        This Node starts by initializing the control and application objects

      • addInputEvent

        public void addInputEvent(Event e)
        Add an event to the Node input queue so the node will treat it in the next execution step.
        Parameters:
        e - the event to add.

      • getOutputEvent

        public Event getOutputEvent()
        Return an output Event generated by the execution step to be treated by the main loop of the simulator
        Returns:
        Event, the event

      • dumpPacketStats

        public void dumpPacketStats(int now)
        Dump packet Stats to stdout for both the router and each link. s : sent , r : recv , d : drop , f : forw
        Parameters:
        now - the current virtual time

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Gets this Node id

        public void process_input_events(int n)
        Process the Events scheduled by the simulator for this processing step
        Parameters:
        n - - current instant

      • send

        public void send(DataPacket p)
        Sends an application DataPacket; by convention the input interface of a locally created and sent packet is the local interface (-1) this method is to be be used by the application algorithm
        Parameters:
        p - the packet

      • send

        public void send(Packet p,
                 int iface)
        Sends a Packet using a given interface Besides increasing counters, this could be done by Control Algorithms It is however, cleaner and better practice to make it available here to be shared by all different ControlAlgorithms
        Parameters:
        p - the packet
        iface - the interface

      • getInterfaceWeight

        public int getInterfaceWeight(int iface,
                              int type)
        Returns the interface weight for the specified interface. This may or should be computed by Control Algorithms. However, it is given as an help and example
        Parameters:
        iface - the interface
        type - (= 1, weight always 1 for RIP, 2 weight better than RIP weight , 3 weight for OSPF
        Returns:
        int (weight)

      • set_timeout

        public void set_timeout(int t)
        Installs an application timeout The reception of a data message before or at now+t cancels all application timeouts (including those to be delivered in the same time step)
        Parameters:
        t - the timeout value

      • set_control_timeout

        public void set_control_timeout(int t)
        Installs a control timeout The reception of a data message before or at now+t cancels all control timeouts (including those to be delivered in the same time step)
        Parameters:
        t - the timeout value

      • createDataPacket

        public DataPacket createDataPacket(int receiver,
                                   byte[] payload)
        Creates a data packet with the current node as sender the ApplicationAlgorithm could implement the functionality but setting a good sequence number
        Parameters:
        receiver - the receiver id
        payload - the payload of the packet
        Returns:
        the created data packet

      • createControlPacket

        public ControlPacket createControlPacket(int sender,
                                         int receiver,
                                         byte[] payload)
        Creates a control packet the ControlAlgorithm could implement the functionality but setting a good sequence number
        Parameters:
        sender - the sender id
        receiver - the receiver id
        payload - the payload of the packet
        Returns:
        the created data packet

      • getInterfaceState

        public boolean getInterfaceState(int iface)
        Returns the interface state for the specified interface, is it up or down.
        Parameters:
        iface - the interface
        Returns:
        boolean (true if is Up)
